u_shaped_ranking.core_sentence: indicator because it is practical to measure, good for assessing long-term changes in community structure
u_shaped_ranking.context_window: Background (brief) Abundance (numbers of adult birds in the non-breeding season or pairs at breeding colonies) is used as an indicator because it is practical to measure, good for assessing long-term changes in community structure and because it changes slowly under natural conditions. Rapid changes in abundance can indicate human-

u_shaped_ranking.core_sentence: The threshold values used in this indicator assessment were developed for breeding seabird abundance data
u_shaped_ranking.context_window: Many waterbird species in this assessment breed inland and in areas outside the OSPAR Maritime Area. The threshold values used in this indicator assessment were developed for breeding seabird abundance data in order to assess the OSPAR Ecological Quality Objective (EcoQO) on seabird population trends as an index of seabird community health (ICES, 2008, 2010, 2011, 2012).

u_shaped_ranking.context_window: Separate assessments were carried out for relative breeding abundance and relative non-breeding abundance. u_shaped_ranking.core_sentence: Our vision is a clean, healthy and biologically diverse North-East Atlantic
u_shaped_ranking.context_window: La reproduction de tout ou partie de ce rapport dans une publication peut être autorisée par l’Editeur, sous réserve que l’origine de l’extrait soit clairement mentionnée. Our vision is a clean, healthy and biologically diverse North-East Atlantic Ocean, which is productive, used sustainably and resilient to climate change and ocean acidification.

u_shaped_ranking.context_window: Table 1 . In three out of four of the OSPAR Regions assessed, less than 75% of all species assessed across the functional groups have achieved threshold values for relative breeding abundance, indicating that the bird communities are not healthy.

sentences.content: Marine birds are in poor status and declining in most of the OSPAR Maritime Area.
feeding at the water surface, diving to the seafloor or foraging in shallow water / on mudflats, whe...
feeding in the water column and herbivores are usually doing better.
Taken as a whole, marine birds (breeding and non-breeding separately and together) were below the
threshold value in Arctic Waters, Greater North Sea, and Celtic Seas.
This is a similar situation to the
assessment reported for IA 2017 and in general, continues a long-term decline in status.
Wading feeders and benthic feeders never achieved the threshold value in all Regions assessed, altho...
should be noted that only few benthic feeder species could be assessed.
in bad status, with the exception of eight species assessed in the Bay of Biscay and Iberian Coast.
